name: NewYorker
text: The coronavirus pandemic, as has often been noted, oﬀers an opportunity to reopen with a greater recognition of inequalities. For the school system, there is a risk that the reopening process will only amplify those divisions. https://t.co/F7XD6z7N0i

name: NewYorker
text: Zoos still have to feed and care for animals—nearly a million, from 6,000 species in the United States alone—at a time in which revenues have plummeted to nothing, the president of the Association of Zoos and Aquariums said. https://t.co/he9kxWSMl1

name: NewYorker
text: If your vacation is cancelled this year, join two passive-aggressive British comedians eating their way through Lesbos, Athens, and Hydra. https://t.co/bfw6F6MMeO

name: NewYorker
text: “My before-self, before the pandemic, valued her sense of cheerful nihilism,” @EmilyFlake writes. “The tense, watchful person that replaced her is so quick to anger, so quick to cry, so agitated, and so sad.” https://t.co/eUJylKWcJT

name: NewYorker
text: “In society nothing is permanent,” Yuval Noah Harari, the author of “Sapiens,” says. “There’s no essence, no essence to any nation.” In his worldview, many of our daily political struggles barely matter. https://t.co/LoMFhDwfMq

name: NewYorker
text: “This new solitude feels lean and hard. As I move deeper into it, I worry that it will replace all the subtle textures of the solitude into which I’ve grown over the last 30 years.” https://t.co/NcCdL5bvIb

name: NewYorker
text: For the philosopher Søren Kierkegaard, unhappiness was not a condition but a vocation—he called his melancholy “the most faithful mistress I have known.” https://t.co/nREN4oumMH

name: NewYorker
text: "Today I baked bread, organized my canned goods, and polished all of my exploding gas balls. Again." https://t.co/GVW1UP0YNv

name: NewYorker
text: Investors are responding to a widely shared narrative that says stock prices tend to rebound sharply after a big fall, an economist said. But stocks don’t always rebound in a “V” shape. https://t.co/uA1FGBry0N

name: NewYorker
text: Any study of the codpiece begins with two simple questions: Why did it exist at all, and why did men elect to wear it? https://t.co/82ABfwhr9R
